thread.title: Burlington Boy Scouts lend a hand
thread.title_full: Burlington Boy Scouts lend a hand - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: Rose Spillman
title: Burlington Boy Scouts lend a hand
text:
BURLINGTON, Vt. - Burlington Boy Scouts got together this weekend to give back to the community.
Seventeen year old Blaise Rainville organized the service project in the hopes of eventually becoming an Eagle Scout. Rainville raised around 6-hundred dollars to clean up and repair a historic building on Hyde Street that he says is very important to the Jewish community in Burlington. Rainville brought in his family and fellow boy scouts to help fix up the building.
"We're cleaning brush and repainting this out building which is used by members of the Jewish faith to hold vigil over the dead for 24 hours before they're buried," Rainville said.
The building and connected synagogue date back to 1885 and are still in use.
